title: Saudi energy minister defends US shale producers: 'They are creating jobs'
author: Matt Clinch
points: ["The U.S. is now the world's largest oil producer hitting 12.3 million b/d in 2019, according to the U.S. Energy Information Administration, up from 11 million b/d in 2018. ", 'It produces more oil than Saudi Arabia and Russia now, although there are signs that production growth is slowing in the States.']

title: Oil rises as OPEC and allies announce deep production cut
author: Pippa Stevens

title: 'Is this the beginning of the end?': OPEC discord raises questions about its long-term future
author: Sam Meredith
points: ['It was initially unclear whether  OPEC members had secured a deal on Thursday, following an acrimonious meeting that ran late into the evening.', 'Herman Wang, OPEC and Middle East specialist at S&P Global Platts, said the meeting had caused him to question the long-term future of OPEC.', 'Speaking to CNBC\'s Dan Murphy in Vienna on Friday, Wang said: "What we saw last night was not a unified OPEC. Is this the beginning of the end?"']

title: OPEC and its allies agree to deepen oil production cuts
author: Sam Meredith
points: ['The new deal, which is much larger than many analysts had expected, will see OPEC+ reduce total oil output by 1.7 million b/d.', "Saudi Arabia's Energy Minister Prince Abdulaziz bin Salman\xa0explained his country would also extend a voluntary cut of 400,000 b/d. ", "This means the energy alliance's total cuts would effectively amount to 2.1 million b/d, he said.", 'The energy alliance has said it plans to review the policy at a meeting on March 5-6.']

title: Saudi minister looks to make his mark as OPEC meeting gets underway
author: Hadley Gamble
points: ['With current cuts set to expire in March, sources told Reuters that a new deal could be extended to June or until the end of 2020. ', 'Key to any deal will be the ability to get all members on side, including Russia.']

title: Saudi Arabia denies pushing OPEC allies to commit to a deeper round of production cuts, source says
author: Sam Meredith
points: ['The oil-rich kingdom was widely considered to be pushing for other OPEC members to sign up for at least an additional 400,000 barrels per day of production cuts on Thursday. ', 'But, one anonymous Saudi oil official told CNBC on the sidelines of a meeting in Vienna, Austria that this was not the case — and Riyadh had not proposed any figures.', 'OPEC and non-OPEC allies — sometimes referred to as OPEC+ — have gathered in Vienna this week to discuss the next phase of their oil production policy.']

title: OPEC meeting ends with market expecting deep production cut
author: Holly Ellyatt
points: ['Global oil-producing group OPEC reportedly considered cutting production by an additional 500,000 barrels per day as its biannual meeting kicked off Thursday in Vienna.', 'The reported 500,000 cut is larger than the numbers floated ahead of the meeting. It would bring the total production cut to 1.7 million barrels per day.', 'On Friday, OPEC and its allies — known as OPEC+ and which includes Russia — will meet to finalize any proposed measures, including how any cuts would be implemented by each country.']

title: Everything you need to watch out for at this week's OPEC+ meeting
author: Sam Meredith
points: ['OPEC members will host a meeting in Vienna, Austria, on Thursday to discuss the next phase of their oil production policy.', 'The 14-member group will then hold talks with non-OPEC allies on Friday.', '"I think there is a possibility that we see around 400,000 barrels per day deeper cuts," Amrita Sen, chief oil analyst at Energy Aspects, told CNBC\'s Dan Murphy in Vienna on Wednesday.']

title: Here are 5 major storylines to follow heading into the big OPEC meeting this week
author: Brian Sullivan

title: Russia opens Siberian pipeline to China as Beijing expands its influence in the Arctic
author: Grace Shao
points: ['The pipeline comes after China unveiled a plan nearly two years ago called the "Polar Silk Road," expanding its campaign for influence to the Arctic.', 'The resource-rich region is at the heart of the geopolitical battle and struggle for influence.', "As Moscow's relationship with Western countries becomes more frail, Russian business leaders look for more economic opportunities with China, especially in energy."]

title: Repsol says it will reach zero emissions by 2050
author: Pippa Stevens
points: ['Spain-based Repsol said on Monday that it will be carbon neutral by 2050.', 'The company said changes to its oil operations — including shifting the upstream focus to value creation rather than volume, and integrating renewable energy into its refining operations — as well as an increase in its alternative energy portfolio will help the company reach zero emissions.', '"We are convinced that we must set more ambitious objectives to fight climate change," Repsol CEO Josu Jon Imaz said in a statement. "We are convinced that this strengthens our project that is sustainable, attractive and profitable for all our stakeholders."']

title: Natural gas is one of the few trades that hasn't worked on Wall Street, down 50% in 12 months
author: Pippa Stevens
points: ['Natural gas prices fell to a one-month low on Friday, and are currently nearly 50% below where they traded a year ago.', 'Warmer temperatures and record production levels have led to oversupply concerns.', 'The "recent dip in prices may have run its course," KKM Financial\'s Jeff Kilburg said. "I believe you have to respect the range and view the recent selling action as a Black Friday sale for Nat Gas," he added.', 'Longer-term Bespoke Weather chief meteorologist Brian Lovern said that if warmer temperatures continue prices could plunge below the $2.00 level.']

title: Tesla cars built in China have been recommended for government subsidies, report says
author: Anmar Frangoul
points: ['Tesla is one of several vehicle firms attempting to make inroads into the Chinese market.', 'China is home to the biggest electric car market on the planet.']

title: Governments are adopting different strategies for reducing their carbon footprint
author: Nessa Anwar

title: Amazon gives green light to new solar projects in the US and Spain
author: Anmar Frangoul
points: ['The three facilities are expected to generate nearly 700,000 megawatt hours of energy per year.', 'Amazon is not alone in its desire be more sustainable, with many major firms attempting to use more renewable energy to power their operations.\xa0']

title: The past decade is set to be the warmest on record
author: Anmar Frangoul
points: ["The World Meteorological Organization's report paints a stark picture.", 'This year is now "on course" to be the second or third warmest on record, it says.\xa0']

title: Major European utility Iberdrola plans to replace coal-fired plants with solar, wind
author: Anmar Frangoul
points: ['The coal-fired plants are in the north of the country and have a combined capacity of 874 megawatts.', 'On the first day of the COP25 climate summit in Madrid, Ignacio Galan seeks to emphasize the importance of the COP21 summit, which took place in Paris in 2015.']

title: COP25 climate summit starts as UN chief says the planet faces a 'point of no-return'
author: Anmar Frangoul
points: ['The COP25 climate summit, in the Spanish capital of Madrid, got underway Monday.', 'UN secretary general\xa0Antonio Guterres says "we simply have to stop digging and drilling."']

title: Governments are adopting different strategies for reducing their carbon footprint
author: Nessa Anwar

title: For people with student debt, 2020 could be the year everything changes
author: Annie Nova
points: ['Several plans would\xa0rewrite the rules around student loan interest, repayment and refinancing.', 'Some of the changes would leave people with less debt and different ways to repay it.\xa0']

title: Kudlow says a trade deal is close, but Trump is prepared to 'walk away' if some conditions not met
author: Yun Li
points: ['Kudlow said  the U.S. and China are close to a trade deal, "probably even closer than in mid-November."', 'The administration was prepared to walk away if they did not get the terms they wanted, he said.', '"The president has said that if we can not get the enforcement and the assurances, then we will not go forward," he said.']

title: SoftBank will get the 'last laugh' when a 'profitable' WeWork goes public one day, Bernstein says
author: Yun Li
points: ['Chris Lane, senior research analyst at AB Bernstein, said SoftBank will have the "last laugh" when it brings the company back to market in a few years.', "The analyst compared WeWork's model to Starbuck's where the profitability comes from big scale.\xa0", 'SoftBank recorded a $3.4 billion writedown on its WeWork investment about two weeks after taking 80% control of the company with a new $5 billion financing package.']

title: Your first trade for Friday, December 6
author: Tyler Bailey

title: Look out Chick-fil-A and Popeyes, McDonald's new chicken sandwich is 'really good,' analyst says
author: Maggie Fitzgerald
points: ['McDonald\'s is expected to launch a crispy chicken sandwich in the beginning of next year and Telsey Advisory Group said its going to be a "big U.S. hit for the chain."\xa0', 'The U.S. chicken marketplace has grown more than 14% this year to about $4.5 million sales per store, according to the firm.\xa0', "Chick-fil-A, Popeye's and Wendy's have achieved great success from the rise in popularity of their chicken sandwiches."]

title: Biden says Trump's pressure on the Federal Reserve is an abuse of power
author: Thomas Franck
points: ["President Trump's attacks on the Federal Reserve and Chairman Jerome Powell are an abuse of power, according to 2020 front-runner Joe Biden.", '"The president should not be trying to pressure the Fed," Biden says in an interview with CNBC. "That\'s supposed to be an independent entity out here."', 'The president lambasted what he considered multiple restrictive interest rate hikes throughout 2018 and has said "People are VERY disappointed in Jay Powell."']

title: Stocks making the biggest moves premarket: Tesla, Tapestry, Big Lots, Uber, Ulta & more
author: Peter Schacknow

title: This chart shows how 'depressing' life has been for stock pickers
author: Maggie Fitzgerald
points: ['In a universe of 16,000 global and emerging market stocks, only 22% have beat the S&P 500 in the past two years, according to\xa0Societe Generale.', '"The strong performance of the S&P 500 leaves everything in its wake," said Andrew Lapthorne, Global Head of Quantitative Research at the firm.\xa0', "It's no surprise that assets in passive investing topped those of active investing for the first time ever in August,\xa0as\xa0passive investing consistently outperforms active over long time periods despite active management charging higher fees."]

title: Stocks making the biggest moves after hours: Ulta, CrowdStrike, Zoom Video and more
author: Ganesh Setty

title: November's jobs report to show pick-up in pace from October, but mostly because of GM effect
author: Patti Domm
points: ['The economy is expected to have added 180,000 or more jobs in November, but the real trend of job growth is more like 150,000.', "The pace of job growth has slowed this year, and in fact for the year-to-date through October, it's the slowest pace since the early days of the recovery in 2010.", "Job growth is still strong enough, however, and the slower pace should have no impact on the Fed's decision, unless it falls more.", 'Economists said the slower growth is due to a lack of workers and the trade war.']

title: Digital bank Chime quadruples valuation in less than a year to $5.8 billion as it takes on megabanks
author: Hugh Son
points: ['Chime, valued at $1.5 billion in March, is now pegged at $5.8 billion just\xa0nine months later, according to people with knowledge of the matter.', 'The leading U.S. digital bank raised a record $500 million in a Series E, showing that massive funding rounds are still available for some start-ups.', "Chime will use the money to build on its torrid growth, including doubling the company's headcount by 2020 and potentially acquiring competitors, the people said."]

title: Here's what happened to the stock market on Thursday
author: Fred Imbert

title: Jobs report, consumer sentiment, Kudlow speaks: 3 things to watch for Friday
author: Yun Li

title: US and China disagree on the size of agriculture purchases, report says
author: Yun Li
points: ['President Donald Trump is asking China to buy $40 billion to $50 billion of farm goods a year, which is significantly higher than the $8.6 billion the country bought last year, The Wall Street Journal reported.', "The administration is also demanding that China publicly announce its purchasing plans and say that they wouldn't depend on market conditions or China's trade obligations, sources told the Journal."]

title: Treasury Secretary Mnuchin says China should be 'graduated' from supportive World Bank loan program
author: Thomas Franck
points: ['Asked by Republican Rep. Anthony Gonzalez whether he\'d support graduating Beijing from select World Bank lending, Mnuchin replied, "I do."', 'The question from Gonzalez comes as the congressman works to pass legislation that would curb World Bank funding to China.', '"China claims that it wants to be seen as an equal to the U.S. in the global economy. If that\'s the case, it needs to step up," former U.S. trade advisor Clete Willems says.']

title: Despite the rise of online banks, millennials are still visiting branches
author: Kate Rooney
points: ['A new report from Jefferies suggests that young people are still embracing bank branches, despite the rise of digital-only banks.', 'Physical banking locations "are still viewed as important" and are still a top factor in picking a new bank, according to a new Jefferies retail banking survey. Respondents are still relying on physical locations, especially those age 18 to 34.', 'So-called challenger banks have raised more than $3 billion in venture capital funding this year, according to CB Insights.']

title: Nearly 40% of Facebook's valuation is on the line from regulatory risk, HSBC says
author: Maggie Fitzgerald
points: ['HSBC Global Strategies initiated coverage of Facebook with a reduce rating, recommending investors sell the stock.', "The firm said\xa0said regulatory overhang is\xa0equivalent to 38.5% of Facebook's current valuation.", 'Trust-busting, anti-competitive fines, privacy fines, taxation, merger control and telecoms-type regulation all pose potential implications to valuation the firm said.\xa0']

title: Goldman Sachs has a simple 'laggard' stocks strategy for early 2020 that tends to beat the market
author: Yun Li
points: ['The strategy to pick up battered stocks in the beginning of a given year has a good track record of beating the market, according to Goldman. ', 'Among the bottom third of the S&P 500 in terms of 2019 performance, Goldman recommended buying the laggards that its analysts have out-of-consensus buy ratings and above-consensus estimates.', 'Westlake Chemical, L Brands, Terex, Yelp, Cree and Under Armour are some of the "buy-rated laggards" of 2019 where the majority of the Street has neutral or sell ratings but Goldman analysts recommend buying.']

title: Your first trade for Thursday, December 5
author: Tyler Bailey

title: US trade deficit drops in October to lowest level in more than a year
author: Fred Imbert
points: ['The U.S. trade deficit tumbled 7.6% to $47.2 billion in October from a revised print of $51.1 billion for September.', 'Imports dropped by 1.7%, or $4.3 billion, to $254.3 billion.', 'Exports dipped 0.2%, or $400 million, to $207.1 billion.']

title: Shares of biotech Aurinia surge 78% after positive data for Lupus drug
author: Yun Li
points: ['Aurinia said\xa0its phase three trial for drug voclosporin posted positive efficacy and safety results  in the treatment of lupus nephritis.', 'Some analysts expect the stock to quadruple on the better-than-expected trial results.']

title: Stocks making the biggest moves premarket: Nike, Dollar General, Apple, Chewy, Tiffany & more
author: Peter Schacknow

title: This seasonal trend implies investors will be cheering December — despite the choppy start
author: Stephanie Landsman

title: Robinhood democratizes stocks for younger generations, co-founder says
author: Tyler Clifford
points: ['"I think it\'s just a testament to what we\'ve been able to do," Robinhood co-CEO Vladimir Tenev tells CNBC\'s Jim Cramer about the company reaching 10 million subscribers.', '"We\'re proud of the fact that we\'ve enabled so many younger investors and first-time investors to have access to the markets" in the wake of the 2008 financial crisis, he says in a "Mad Money" interview.', '"We saw an opportunity to build a product that really spoke to [the millennial] generation, and commission is a part of it," co-CEO Baiju Bhatt says.']

title: Stocks making biggest moves after hours: Slack, Verint, Five Below & more
author: Al Lewis

title: Here's what happened to the stock market on Wednesday
author: Fred Imbert

title: Jobs data, Tiffany earnings, Aramco IPO final pricing: 3 things to watch for Thursday
author: Yun Li

title: Bull markets often end with a euphoric rally called a 'blow-off top.' We may have just had one
author: Fred Imbert
points: ['The Dow was up 10.5% over the course of just 74 trading days from mid-August to late November.', 'That kind of rally is similar to the ones that ended previous bull markets, data from Ned Davis Research shows.', 'The Dow has posted a median gain of 13.4% over a median time frame of 61 days in blow-off tops dating to 1901, according to the data.']

title: Job growth is slowing in the trade war, but that may not be clear in Friday's payroll data
author: Patti Domm
points: ['Job growth looks to be in a slower trajectory, and the trade war has clearly taken its toll, economists say.', "The ADP payroll report showing only 67,000 private-sector jobs were added in November raises worries that the government's data on Friday may not be as strong as expected.", 'The impact of returning workers from the GM strike may muddy the November report, but in a positive way.']

title: Stocks making the biggest moves midday: Expedia, Salesforce, Workday, Alphabet & more
author: Yun Li

title: Your first trade for Wednesday, Nov. 4
Start-up Robinhood tops 10 million accounts even as industry follows in free-trading footsteps
author: Maggie Fitzgerald
points: ['Silicon Valley start-up Robinhood has more than 10 million accounts, the company said Wednesday.', 'Robinhood has grown rapidly from its one million subscribers in 2016 and six million users in October of 2018.', 'Robinhood landed a $7.6 billion valuation in July after its latest funding round.']

author: Stephanie Landsman

author: Peter Schacknow

title: Stocks making the biggest moves after hours: Alphabet, Salesforce.com, Workday & more
author: Ganesh Setty

title: Without a trade deal this year, 'I don't know if I want to be around equities,' Jeremy Siegel says
author: Yun Li
points: ['If Trump doesn\'t reach a trade deal with China and "the tariffs get put on on Dec. 15 ... I don\'t know if I want to be around equities then," Siegel said.', 'The Dow Jones Industrial Average dropped more than 250 points after President Donald Trump indicated he might wait till 2020 to strike a trade deal with China.', '"Yields are going to stay really low with Treasuries being a hedge asset like this ... Utilities and defensive stocks, anything that gets you yield, I think is going to do pretty well in 2020," Siegel said.']

title: Here's what happened to the stock market on Tuesday
author: Fred Imbert

title: How the market sell-off could get much worse: 'Better put on your helmet'
author: Bob Pisani
points: ['The market is grappling with the likelihood of no trade deal, but the critical issue is tariffs.', 'If additional tariffs are put in place on Dec. 15, "then there\'s another sell-off," according to Art Cashin, UBS director of floor operations.', 'Despite signs that a phase one deal might not be achieved, bulls are holding out the prospects that the markets might be mollified by any sign that talks are continuing.']

title: Stocks making the biggest moves midday: Caterpillar, Lands' End, Micron and more
author: Maggie Fitzgerald

title: Investors fear another December sell-off if Trump lets tariffs take effect Dec. 15
author: Patti Domm
points: ["President Trump's comment that he could wait until after the 2020 election for a trade deal with China sent stocks reeling.", 'Markets had been expecting a trade deal by Dec. 15 — the date for another round of tariffs on Chinese goods are scheduled to take effect.', '"I think investors are using Dec. 15 as a barometer. It\'s probably the purest, simplest barometer, to see if progress is being made. If it isn\'t, we\'ll probably limp in the rest of the year," one strategist says of the market.']

title: If we are in for another December market plunge, here are the places to hide out
author: Maggie Fitzgerald
points: ['Stocks have dropped the first two trading days of December and investors are worried markets are about to repeat last year, the worst December decline since the Great Depression.', 'The Cboe Volatility Index, a gauge for investor fear, jumped above the 17 level on Tuesday.\xa0The index ended the day around 15.8.\xa0', 'CNBC used Kensho, a hedge fund analytics tool, to screen for the best places for investors to hide out when volatility jumps.', 'Consumer staples, utilities and health care are the best sectors to find shelter during volatility.']

title: Distressed investing experts say crisis in oil patch is mounting, but could present opportunities
author: Dawn Giel
points: ['Oil and gas companies are facing a slew of headwinds: stagnant commodity prices, along with supply, transportation and geopolitical challenges.', 'It could be an opportunity for strategic distressed debt investors, a trio of distressed investing and financing experts said on Monday.', 'Todd Dittman of alternative investment firm Angelo Gordon said  private equity investors should buy PDP, or proved developed producing reserves, at cheap prices, lever modestly, and hedge.']

title: Your first trade for Tuesday, December 3
author: Tyler Bailey

title: Stocks making the biggest moves premarket: Lands' End, AK Steel, UnitedHealth, Intel & more
author: Peter Schacknow

title: Economist tells newspaper he was forced out from Chinese bank because he's a Hong Konger
author: Evelyn Cheng
points: ['Law Ka-chung stepped down as chief economist at the Hong Kong unit of a Chinese state-owned bank and has alleged he was forced to do so because he is a native of Hong Kong, the Financial Times reported on Tuesday.', '"They don\'t think it\'s appropriate for a Hong Kong guy to speak on behalf of a Chinese bank," Law told the newspaper, in his first interview with an international English-language media organization since being asked to resign.', 'The Bank of Communications did not immediately respond to a CNBC request for comment.']

title: Stocks making the biggest moves after hours: Coupa Software, Arrowhead Pharmaceuticals & more
author: Ganesh Setty

title: Here's what happened to the stock market on Monday
author: Fred Imbert

title: Markets are counting down to the Dec. 15 trade deadline and could be choppy until then
author: Patti Domm
points: ['Now that December is underway, markets are focused on the mid-month deadline that will determine whether there is a trade deal or new tariffs on Chinese goods.', 'Stocks sold off at the start of the month on weaker-than-expected manufacturing data, an Achilles heal of the economy most impacted by trade.', 'President Trump said Monday he would put new steel and aluminium tariffs on Argentina and Brazil, claiming the two countries manipulated their currencies.', 'The new tariffs on South American countries was a warning for investors that trade wars may not end even if there is a deal with China.']

title: Jack Dorsey's planned move to Africa divides Square and Twitter investors
author: Kate Rooney
points: ['The CEO of Twitter and Square announced plans to move to Africa for up to six months next year.', 'Analysts have doubts about who will run the companies in his absence. While some Square analysts are bullish on the payments opportunity, they want to know who will “mind the store” while Dorsey is abroad.', 'Yale’s Jeff Sonnenfeld said a six-month leave would be “reckless” on the CEO’s part and allowing it would be “irresponsible and negligent” on the part of the board.']

title: Stocks making the biggest moves midday: Roku, Wells Fargo, Deere, Apache & more
author: Fred Imbert

title: Investors kick off December by bailing on hot momentum stocks like Roku
author: Yun Li
points: ['The iShares Edge MSCI USA Momentum Factor ETF (MTUM) underperformed the broad market on Monday.', 'The top 10 performers this year in the S&P 500 are all in the red on the first trading day of December.', 'The Cboe Volatility Index,  the VIX or "fear gauge," jumped to a five-week high of 14.6 on Monday after weeks of tranquility.']

title: Target and Walmart top the list of Wall Street analysts' Black Friday winners
author: Maggie Fitzgerald
points: ['Black Friday foot traffic declined about 6% since last year, the weakest result since 2014, according to ShopperTrak.', 'Meanwhile, online sales for Thanksgiving and Black Friday increased 17% year over year, according to Adobe Analytics.', 'Target and Walmart were stand-out performers of Black Friday with both retailers reaching strong traffic storewide, according to Wall Street.']

title: Virtus Capital president says markets would sell off big if a 'socialist' is elected president
author: Dawn Giel
points: ['Steven Gidumal, the managing partner of Virtus Capital, said markets could tank 30% to 50% if a "socialist" is elected in 2020.', 'Gidumal also said that he thinks President Donald Trump making public comments on the Federal Reserve  is the right thing to do.', '"I think Trump is absolutely right to bash the Fed and to do it publicly because a lot of what they do is irrational and has been for the past century," Gidumal said.']

title: In 2019, almost every investment worked
author: Yun Li
points: ['The S&P 500 is up more than 25% and counting. Treasurys also soared in 2019. Oil, gold and corporate bonds all scored double-digit returns.', 'Only 64 names in the S&P 500, or 12%, are in the red this year. All 11 S&P 500 sectors are entering the homestretch of 2019  with positive returns.', '"What a year for the stock market," says Matthew Maley, chief market strategist at Miller Tabak. "One reason why the consensus believes the stock market can hold up next year has to do with the belief that interest rates will remain low."']

title: Silicon Valley giants accused of avoiding over $100 billion in taxes over the last decade
author: Chloe Taylor

title: Stocks making the biggest moves premarket: Disney, Las Vegas Sands, Fiat Chrysler & more
author: Peter Schacknow

title: 5G broadband is an existential threat to cable companies, but execs and investors aren't worried
author: Alex Sherman
points: ['Verizon, AT&T and T-Mobile are all planning to offer home broadband products for the first time that can theoretically compete with cable internet.', "Cable executives are taking the new products seriously but are expressing little concern about mobile operators' offerings.", '"We agree 5G technology works, but we don\'t believe it\'s a real threat to our business," said Dexter Goei, CEO of cable provider Altice USA.']

title: Black Friday shopping at brick-and-mortar stores dropped by 6% as consumers spent record online
author: Alex Sherman
points: ['Black Friday sales for brick-and-mortar stores dropped 6.2% after shopping on Thanksgiving Day rose 2.3%, according to ShopperTrak data.', 'The pullback in brick-and-mortar stores mirrored a surge in Black Friday online shopping, which hit $7.4 billion, an all-time record for the day, according to Adobe Analytics.', 'Eight of the 10 busiest shopping days are still to come in 2019, according to ShopperTrak.\xa0']

title: Black Friday shoppers spend record $7.4 billion in second largest online sales day ever
author: Alex Sherman
points: ["Black Friday online sales reached $7.4 billion, the second largest online shopping day ever, behind last year's Cyber Monday, according to Adobe Analytics.", 'Abode still predicts an even larger Cyber Monday, estimating sales of $9.4 billion.\xa0', '"Small Business Saturday" has taken in about $470 million as of 9 a.m. ET, on pace to top $3 billion, according to Adobe.']

title: Facebook has a theory that hiding 'likes' will increase post volume, and Instagram is testing it
author: Salvador Rodriguez
points: ['Inside Facebook\'s growth and data science teams, there is a hypothesis that getting rid of "likes" may be an effective tactic for getting users to post more original content on Instagram, three former employees told CNBC.', "The theory goes that by hiding like counts, users may feel less self-conscious when they post photos or videos that don't receive many likes. This in turn may serve as a catalyst for getting users to post more often.", "Head of Instagram Adam Mosseri has presented the experiment as an effort to combat the social network's problem with cyberbullying."]

title: Amazon blames holiday delivery delays on winter storms and high demand
author: William Feuer
points: ['Amazon said it is experiencing shipping delays due to high demand and winter storms as the holiday shopping season kicks off.', 'Customers took to Facebook and Twitter to express frustration with the delays.', 'This holiday season is the first year that Amazon will take on some of the busiest months of the year without one of its major delivery partners, FedEx Ground.']

title: T-Mobile is eyeing a price cut in its merger with Sprint, sources say
author: Thomas Franck
points: ["T-Mobile is considering a cut to its multibillion merger with Sprint, people familiar with the matter tell CNBC's David Faber.", 'The deal cannot close until the companies resolve an ongoing lawsuit from several state attorneys general. The trial is slated to begin on Monday.']

title: How Uber is addressing its sexual assault problem after more than 3,000 incidents last year
author: Lora Kolodny
points: ['Uber revealed that more than 3,000 sexual assaults occurred during rides on its service in the U.S. in 2018 in a comprehensive US Safety Report on Thursday.', '"Voluntarily publishing a report that discusses these difficult safety issues is not easy," wrote Tony West, chief legal officer at Uber in the report.', 'The ride-hailing company and peers including Lyft have been criticized over sexual assault problems for years. The report also details new features and practices Uber is trying to prevent assaults.']

title: TikTok chief to meet with lawmakers next week as suspicions about the app's ties to China grow
author: Lauren Feiner
points: ['TikTok chief Alex Zhu will meet with lawmakers in Washington, D.C. next week, CNBC has confirmed.', 'The trip comes as TikTok is facing scrutiny from the Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States (CFIUS), a person familiar with the matter previously told CNBC.', 'TikTok has rejected censoring content or storing data in a way that would make it vulnerable to being accessed by the Chinese government.']

title: It's not just Peloton — here are some of the biggest advertising whiffs from major brands
author: Megan Graham
points: ["Peloton's ad troubles are just the next in a long list of campaigns that brands took the heat for.", "Advertising in today's culture can hurt perception of a brand because consumers consider advertising a window into a company's culture and values.\xa0"]

title: Tesla cars built in China have been recommended for government subsidies, report says
author: Anmar Frangoul
points: ['Tesla is one of several vehicle firms attempting to make inroads into the Chinese market.', 'China is home to the biggest electric car market on the planet.']

title: SoftBank's Vision Fund 2 has held talks to invest $150 million in home health-care start-up Honor
author: Alex Sherman
points: ['SoftBank has held talks to investment $150 million in home health-care start-up Honor, sources say.', "The deal hasn't been approved by the Vision Fund investment committee and could still fall apart, sources say.", 'The investment marks one of the first known potential investments for Vision Fund 2, which is still in fundraising mode and may raise up to $108 billion.']

title: How to see the songs and artists you listened to most on Spotify in 2019
author: William Feuer
points: ['Spotify relaunches a feature that shows the songs and artists you listened to most all year.', 'It has other fun stats, too, such as how many minutes you spent listening to Spotify and the first song you played in 2019.', 'Here’s how to use Spotify Wrapped to see what your highlights for 2019 were.']

title: Even the actor who played the 'Peloton husband' is feeling the blowback
author: William Feuer
points: ['The public outcry over the now-infamous Peloton holiday ad has the so-called "Peloton Husband" speaking out in defense of himself.', '"As my face continues to be screen shot online, I wonder what repercussions will come back to me," Sean Hunter, the actor who played the husband in the commercial, writes in a post for Psychology Today.', '"As I continue to reflect on the commercial, I consider these thoughts: Why are people creating so many additional narratives to the story?" he asks.']

title: Veritas Genetics, the start-up that can sequence a genome for under $600, ceases US operations
author: Christina Farr
points: ['Veritas Genetics is ceasing U.S. operations because it has struggled to raise new funds.', 'Part of the problem, says a person familiar with the company, is that investors are skittish about investing in start-ups that have raised financing from funds with roots in China.', 'The company is in talks with potential acquirers.']

title: Here's why some Peloton users love that ad so many have criticized
author: Megan Graham
points: ['A holiday ad for at-home fitness company Peloton went viral recently, with criticisms spanning claims that it was sexist or just "cringey."\xa0', "But some Peloton users are defending the ad publicly, arguing that the ad shows, for example, how motivating the company's classes and community can be.\xa0"]

title: CrowdStrike rises after beating in its third-quarter results
author: Annie Palmer
points: ['CrowdStrike reportes better-than-expected results for the fiscal third quarter of 2020.', 'The company also raises its guidance for the full year and says it expects to be free cash flow positive beginning in fiscal 2021.', 'The stock has been under pressure in recent months, as a result of a broader pullback in software stocks.']

title: Zoom shares slide as growth slows
author: Jordan Novet
points: ['Zoom beat on top and bottom lines and on quarterly guidance.', "Zoom's video conferencing services compete with offerings from Avaya, Cisco and Microsoft."]

title: Digital bank Chime quadruples valuation in less than a year to $5.8 billion as it takes on megabanks
author: Hugh Son
points: ['Chime, valued at $1.5 billion in March, is now pegged at $5.8 billion just\xa0nine months later, according to people with knowledge of the matter.', 'The leading U.S. digital bank raised a record $500 million in a Series E, showing that massive funding rounds are still available for some start-ups.', "Chime will use the money to build on its torrid growth, including doubling the company's headcount by 2020 and potentially acquiring competitors, the people said."]

title: Apple is killing the charging plug on its highest-end phones by 2021, top analyst predicts
author: Annie Palmer
points: ["Apple will launch an iPhone in 2021 that doesn't include a Lightning connector, according to Ming-Chi Kuo, an analyst at TF Securities.", 'The company would only remove the Lightning port from the highest-end iPhone, creating a "completely wireless experience," Kuo wrote in a note to clients on Thursday.', 'Speculation has been building for several years that Apple plans to remove the Lightning connector in favor of other charging technology.']

title: Facebook has a theory that hiding 'likes' will increase post volume, and Instagram is testing it
author: Salvador Rodriguez
points: ['Inside Facebook\'s growth and data science teams, there is a hypothesis that getting rid of "likes" may be an effective tactic for getting users to post more original content on Instagram, three former employees told CNBC.', "The theory goes that by hiding like counts, users may feel less self-conscious when they post photos or videos that don't receive many likes. This in turn may serve as a catalyst for getting users to post more often.", "Head of Instagram Adam Mosseri has presented the experiment as an effort to combat the social network's problem with cyberbullying."]

author: Hugh Son
points: ['Chime, valued at $1.5 billion in March, is now pegged at $5.8 billion just\xa0nine months later, according to people with knowledge of the matter.', 'The leading U.S. digital bank raised a record $500 million in a Series E, showing that massive funding rounds are still available for some start-ups.', "Chime will use the money to build on its torrid growth, including doubling the company's headcount by 2020 and potentially acquiring competitors, the people said."]

title: Salesforce's stock bounces around after revenue and profit beat
author: Ari Levy
points: ["At last month's Dreamforce, Salesforce said it expects to double in size by fiscal 2024, with revenue that year reaching between $34 billion and $35 billion.", 'Since March of 2018, Salesforce has orchestrated its two biggest acquisitions ever as it pursues growth in other software markets.', "While Salesforce's stock has gained this year, it's underperformed the S&P 500 and has been trounced by notable cloud companies such as ServiceNow, Shopify and Veeva."]

title: Peloton's holiday ad made some onlookers cringe, but it won't hurt the brand
author: Megan Graham
points: ['A holiday ad from Peloton portrays a woman whose husband gave her a stationary bike for Christmas.', "Peloton's advertising has been the subject of jokes or criticism for seeming to cater to the very wealthy."]

title: Tesla is poised to deliver Model Y crossover in first quarter of 2020, says Deutsche Bank
author: Lora Kolodny
points: ['A new research note from Deutsche Bank estimates that Tesla will start deliveries of their crossover SUV, the Model Y, in the first quarter of 2020.', 'Elon Musk unveiled the Model Y\xa0in March 2019, with plans for deliveries to begin in the fall of 2020 at that time.', "Suppliers to Tesla told a Taiwan-based newspaper that Tesla had accelerated parts orders for the Model Y and the company's forthcoming commercial truck, the Semi."]

title: Amazon just partnered with Verizon to improve 5G speeds
author: Jon Fortt
points: ['AWS CEO Andy Jassy unveils a suite of new services at the re:Invent conference in Las Vegas on Tuesday.', 'Amazon is partnering with Verizon and others to launch WaveLength, a service that uses 5G networks to transfer data from the cloud at faster speeds.']

title: Airbnb has removed thousands of listings in Boston as new rule takes effect
author: William Feuer
points: ['Airbnb had to comply on Sunday with strict new Boston regulations that require hosts to apply to register their listings.', 'The company had about 4,000 total listings in Boston just over a month ago, according to city officials, and the city has approved 737 applications for registration so far.', "With Airbnb expected to go public next year, such regulations in cities around the country could cool investors' outlook on the company."]

title: How to prevent 'porch pirates' from stealing packages from your door, according to police
author: Todd Haselton
points: ['Thousands of packages are stolen from doorsteps, particularly during the holiday season.', 'One local police department has some tips on how to prevent package theft.', 'Amazon and BoxLock also offer solutions for making sure your packages are delivered safely.']

title: Yale's Sonnenfeld blasts Tesla, Facebook and Twitter boards for their 'fear of founder issues'
author: Jessica Bursztynsky
points: ['Tech companies are increasingly having trouble controlling their founders, management expert Jeffrey Sonnenfeld says.', '"We have boards that seem unable to direct genius founders," says the Yale School of Management senior associate dean.', "Sonnenfeld pointed to Tesla's Elon Musk, Facebook's Mark Zuckerberg, ousted WeWork CEO Adam Neumann and Twitter's and Square's Jack Dorsey as examples."]

title: Google's 'Thanksgiving Four' plan to file unfair labor practice charges with a federal agency
author: Lauren Feiner
points: ['The four former Google employees fired ahead of Thanksgiving said in a blog post Tuesday they plan to file charges with the National Labor Relations Board, claiming Google had unfair labor practices.', 'The group claim the company fired them for engaging in worker organizing efforts.', 'Google has previously said the employees were dismissed for accessing and sharing confidential documents and breaching security.']

title: Unilever has a new take on its CMO role and names its first chief digital and marketing officer
author: Megan Graham
points: ["Unilever's widely respected chief marketing and communications officer Keith Weed left earlier this year, and the company said earlier it intended to change the top marketer role somewhat.\xa0", 'The company has named Conny Braams as Chief Digital & Marketing Officer.\xa0', 'The company also hired former Revlon CEO and President Fabian Garcia as its new President of Unilever North America, replacing Amanda Sourry.\xa0']

title: These are the best apps of 2019, according to Apple
author: Todd Haselton
points: ['Apple just announced the best iPhone, iPad, Mac and Apple TV Apps and Games of 2019.', 'Spectre won the best iPhone app of the year award, while Flow by Moleskine won the best iPad app.', 'The best iPhone game went to Sky: Children of Light, while the best iPad game was awarded to Hyper Light Drifter.']

title: Silicon Valley giants accused of avoiding over $100 billion in taxes over the last decade
author: Chloe Taylor

title: Apple could change its iPhone release schedule to twice a year, JP Morgan says
author: Kif Leswing
points: ['Apple could change its iPhone release strategy to launch new devices twice a year starting in 2021, J.P. Morgan analysts predict.', "Since 2011, Apple has released major new iPhones in September and October. The quarter ending in December is Apple's largest of the year.", 'The shift would give the company increased flexibility to change its products and compete with other device makers that launch new phones throughout the year, J.P. Morgan analysts say.']

title: Apple's 2020 iPads and MacBooks will have new advanced displays, top analyst says
author: Kif Leswing
points: ['Apple is planning to use a new display technology called mini LED in its lineup of laptops and tablets starting next year, according to TF Securities analyst Ming-Chi Kuo.', 'According to Kuo\'s research note, Apple is planning up to six mini LED devices, including a "high-end" iPad Pro launching in the third quarter 2020 and a 16-inch MacBook Pro laptop launching in the fourth quarter of 2020.', '"We believe that the mini LED technology will significantly improve productivity and the entertainment experience," Kuo wrote.']

title: T-Mobile shows why it's still too early to buy a 5G phone
author: Todd Haselton
points: ["T-Mobile's nationwide 5G network will launch on Friday, Dec. 6.", "But don't buy the new 5G phones yet. They only support 600MHz 5G, which is slower than other limited 5G networks from carriers such as Verizon and AT&T.", "Eventually, you'll have phones that support low-band, mid-range and wide-band 5G. Those are the phones you'll want to buy. But they're not going to be available until 2020."]

title: YouTube CEO says she doesn't let her young children watch the main site
author: Annie Palmer
points: ['In an interview with CBS\' "60 Minutes," YouTube CEO Susan Wojcicki said she lets her children watch videos on YouTube Kids but not the main site.', 'YouTube Kids is a version of the app for users under age 13.', 'Wojcicki also says she limits how much time her children spend browsing videos on YouTube Kids.']

title: Veritas Genetics, the start-up that can sequence a genome for under $600, ceases US operations
author: Christina Farr
points: ['Veritas Genetics is ceasing U.S. operations because it has struggled to raise new funds.', 'Part of the problem, says a person familiar with the company, is that investors are skittish about investing in start-ups that have raised financing from funds with roots in China.', 'The company is in talks with potential acquirers.']

title: SoftBank's Vision Fund 2 has held talks to invest $150 million in home health-care start-up Honor
author: Alex Sherman
points: ['SoftBank has held talks to investment $150 million in home health-care start-up Honor, sources say.', "The deal hasn't been approved by the Vision Fund investment committee and could still fall apart, sources say.", 'The investment marks one of the first known potential investments for Vision Fund 2, which is still in fundraising mode and may raise up to $108 billion.']

title: Biogen's stock rises 3% after company releases new data on late-stage Alzheimer's drug
author: Berkeley Lovelace Jr.
points: ["Biogen shares rise after the biotech firm offers more data on its late-stage Alzheimer's drug, aducanumab.", 'Analysts who parsed through it say the lack of any new negatives in the report means that they expect the company will take the data to the Food and Drug Administration.']

title: A digital version of Deepak Chopra is coming to your phone as a chatbot
author: Brandon Gomez
points: ['Dr. Deepak Chopra has partnered with The AI Foundation to create an artificial intelligence version of himself.', '"Digital Deepak" answers questions, share insights and lead users through meditative exercises.', "The app version of Digital Deepak will launch in 2020, and you can sign up now to try it when it's available."]

title: CVS CEO: I saw Hello Kitty logo on a vaping device 5 years ago and knew something was wrong
author: Jessica Bursztynsky
points: ['CVS Health CEO Larry Merlo voices his concerns over the teen vaping crisis and the long-term health risks.', '"We don\'t know the longitudinal effect of these products and something has to be done," he says.', 'CVS stopped selling tobacco products in 2014, the same time Merlo says he saw vaping products pop up.', '"I saw the device with the Hello Kitty logo and the bubblegum liquid," he recalls, saying it raised the question: "What are we doing here?"']

title: Peloton is rolling out new apps for Apple Watch and Amazon Fire TV, plus cheaper pricing
author: Christina Farr
points: ['Peloton is releasing a new app for Apple Watch, which will make it easier for people to access fitness metrics on the go.', 'The company is now offering an app for Fire TV so users can stream fitness content from home.', 'In addition, Peloton is bringing down pricing for its digital service.']

title: White House claims Pelosi's drug-pricing bill would result in 100 fewer drugs over decade
author: Berkeley Lovelace Jr.
points: ["House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's sweeping drug-pricing bill would result in as many as 100 fewer drugs hitting the U.S. market over the next decade, the White House says.", "The report from the administration suggests far greater consequences for both the drug industry and American consumers if Pelosi's bill is enacted."]

title: Senate panel advances Trump's nominee for FDA commissioner
author: Angelica LaVito
points: ["A Senate panel approved Trump's nominee for FDA commissioner in an 18 to 5 vote.\xa0", 'Trump nominated Dr. Stephen Hahn, a Texas oncologist, to lead the FDA.\xa0', "The full Senate will now vote on Hahn's nomination.\xa0"]

title: Dexcom says outage that kept diabetes patients from tracking glucose was 'complete surprise'
author: Christina Farr
points: ["Dexcom experienced it's largest ever technical glitch over the weekend.", "The company's technology chief acknowledged that Dexcom needs to do better.", 'Dexcom is analyzing its tech infrastructure and working to bolster its communications systems.']

title: Cramer: Warren's backtrack on 'Medicare for All' is a boon for this managed-care stock
author: Berkeley Lovelace Jr.
points: ['UnitedHealth\'s stock has "caught fire" due in part to  Warren appearing to "back away" from her "Medicare for All" proposal, according to Jim Cramer.', 'The stock has also rallied because Warren has faltered in some political polls, Cramer says.']

title: Dexcom glitch kept parents of children with diabetes in the dark over the weekend
author: Christina Farr
points: ['Dexcom has experienced technical issues since Saturday morning, keeping parents from learning when a child with diabetes is experiencing dangerous blood sugar swings.', 'Dexcom blamed the problem on a "server overload," which "generated a massive backlog."', 'As of Monday, the service was still intermittent for some users.']

title: Biogen's stock could fall 10% on new Alzheimer's drug data this week, top analyst says
author: Berkeley Lovelace Jr.
points: ["Biogen's stock could fall as much as 10% once it releases new data this week on its\xa0Alzheimer's drug, analyst\xa0Brian Skorney says.", '"We do not think that data validates anything near receiving approval from the FDA," he adds.']

title: Amazon lets doctors record your conversations and put them in your medical files
author: Christina Farr
points: ['Amazon is introducing a virtual medical scribe so doctors can spend more time with patients and less time at the computer.', 'Transcribe Medical is being introduced at re:Invent and is available to AWS customers.', "AWS says it's now possible for doctors to get their notes transcribed in real time with a high degree of accuracy."]

title: Doctors and techies are clashing at digital health companies, and one start-up is seeking a fix
author: Christina Farr
points: ['Digital health companies are struggling in  part because the clinical teams and the product teams are at odds.', "Omada Health's chief medical officer is working on solutions to bridge the gap.", 'Start-ups in the industry raised $8 billion last year, and exits are just starting to produce returns.']

title: United Airlines' next CEO a 'details guy' who will have labor contracts and the 737 Max on his plate
author: Leslie Josephs
points: ["United's board picked president Scott Kirby, an industry veteran, to become its next CEO in 2020.", 'Scott Kirby, who left rival American and joined United in 2016, takes over from Oscar Munoz next May.', 'Munoz and Kirby orchestrated a big turnaround for United, which has grown profits and improved performance.']

title: GM's CEO deflects questions about Tesla's Cybertruck, but sees electric pickups as significant
author: Jessica Bursztynsky
points: ["General Motors' Mary Barra sees a big opportunity in electric pickups — a new segment that's gotten a lot of attention since Tesla's Cybertruck unveiling.", 'Refusing to comment directly on the polarizing Cybertruck, she says, "It\'s the customer\'s decision to decide, not General Motors, certainly not me as the CEO."', 'However, Barra says she "couldn\'t be more excited about our battery-electric truck," which is expected in 2021 and will get its batteries from a new joint venture.']

title: Billionaire businessman Ken Langone talks about stocks he likes, including JP Morgan and GE
author: Jessica Bursztynsky
points: ["Ken Langone says he used Tuesday's stock market drop as a buying opportunity.", '"Where else can you go to get some kind of a decent rate of return, than equities," says Langone.', 'The Home Depot co-founder says he added to positions in J.P. Morgan and\xa0Parker-Hannifin. He says he also likes General Electric again.']

title: Air cargo industry braces for worst year since financial crisis as holidays fail to perk up demand
author: Leslie Josephs
points: ['Air cargo demand continued to fall, even as the peak holiday season began, IATA data shows.', 'The Asia-Pacific and Middle East regions posted the biggest declines in October.', 'Air cargo capacity growth has outstripped supply for the last 18 months.']

title: Boeing hosts industry members at 737 Max factory in charm offensive for beleaguered plane
author: Leslie Josephs
points: ['Boeing invites industry members and analysts to visit with executives and 737 Max facilities to drum up support for the planes.', 'The Boeing 737 Max has been grounded since mid-March after two fatal crashes.', 'Boeing has repeatedly said it expects to gain regulator approval for the planes before the end of the year, but the FAA says it has no timeline.']

title: Hundreds of flights canceled, more than 5,000 delayed in post-Thanksgiving storm
author: Leslie Josephs
points: ['More than 1,000 flights were canceled Sunday and Monday because of the storm.', 'The storm is bringing high winds, snow, rain and ice to the Northeast.', 'Airlines including Delta, American and United waived change fees.']

title: The US consumer is on 'firm footing,' says investor
Hedge fund manager buys Palm Beach estate for $111 million
Housing in 2020 will be most challenging for buyers: Economist
Steve Case: The 230 cities that lost HQ2 'perhaps can create the next Amazon'
author: Barbara Booth
points: ['Steve Case says the 230 cities that lost out on the bid for Amazon\'s HQ2 have the power to "create the next Amazon."', "The AOL co-founder and chairman and CEO of Revolution revealed his theory at CNBC's Capital Exchange event on Wednesday in Washington, D.C.", 'Those cities can turn themselves into start-up ecosystems that can churn out innovative companies, Case explained.']

title: M&G suspends UK's biggest commercial property fund
author: David Reid
points: ['Investors have been unable to withdraw cash from midday Wednesday.', 'M&G blamed Brexit-related uncertainty and "ongoing structural shifts in the UK retail sector."', 'The same fund was suspended in the wake of the 2016 referendum result.']

title: 2020 housing supply could hit historic lows: Report
Home prices might turn negative in some markets
Weekly mortgage applications drop 9% as refinances pull back
author: Diana Olick
points: ['Refinance weakness caused the overall drop. Those applications fell 16% for the week but were 61% higher than a year ago.', 'Mortgage applications to purchase a home increased 1% last week, the Mortgage Bankers Association says.']

title: Next year will be hard on the housing market, especially in these big cities
author: Diana Olick
points: ['Sales of existing homes will fall 1.8% from 2019, according to the forecast.', 'Home prices will flatten nationally, increasing just 0.8% annually, but prices will fall in a quarter of the 100 largest metropolitan markets, including Chicago, Dallas, Las Vegas, Miami, St. Louis, Detroit and San Francisco.', 'As demand heats up in the spring, driven by the growing number of millennials entering the market, the supply of homes for sale could hit its lowest in history.']

title: Airbnb has removed thousands of listings in Boston as new rule takes effect
author: William Feuer
points: ['Airbnb had to comply on Sunday with strict new Boston regulations that require hosts to apply to register their listings.', 'The company had about 4,000 total listings in Boston just over a month ago, according to city officials, and the city has approved 737 applications for registration so far.', "With Airbnb expected to go public next year, such regulations in cities around the country could cool investors' outlook on the company."]

title: Hedge fund billionaire buys Florida mansion for $111 million, setting state record
author: Robert Frank
points: ['Hedge fund billionaire Steven Schonfeld and his wife bought a sprawling Palm Beach estate for $111 million.', 'The 6-acre estate, sold by hair-care mogul Sydell Miller, has more than 70,000 square feet of living space, with 11 bedrooms, 22 bathrooms, a bowling alley, salon, spa, ice cream stand and candy parlor.', 'The sale beats a record for the state set this summer, when an estate owned by the late Broadway producer Terry Allen Kramer sold to an unknown buyer for $110.3 million.']

title: A look at the Frasers Logistics and Frasers Commercial merger
Sanjiv Das: falling interest rates driving growth in the cycle
